Detailed Description

This class provides mean filter functionality for DImage objects.

void DMeanFilter::meanFilterUseIntegralImage_ ( DImage &  imgDst,
const DImage &  imgSrc,
int  radiusX,
int  radiusY,
bool  fAlreadyPadded = false 
) [static]

use fast integral image method for performing mean filter

Compute the mean filtered image using a square kernel of size (2*radiusX+1) by (2*radiusY+1) pixels. For RGB images (or multi-channel float or double images), each channel is filtered independently.

This implementation uses integral images for speed, as described in "Efficient Implementation of Local Adaptive Thresholding Techniques Using Integral Images" by Shafait, Keysers, and Breuel that was to appear in Proc. Document Recognition and Retrieval XV, IST/SPIE Annual Symposium, San Jose, CA, January 2008. It uses more memory than a convolution approach since the integral image must be created and uses long longs or long doubles to prevent overflow.

References DImage::create(), D_CHECKPTR, DImage::dataPointer_dbl(), DImage::dataPointer_flt(), DImage::dataPointer_u16(), DImage::dataPointer_u32(), DImage::dataPointer_u8(), DImage::DImage_dbl_multi, DImage::DImage_flt_multi, DImage::DImage_RGB, DImage::DImage_RGB_16, DImage::DImage_u16, DImage::DImage_u32, DImage::DImage_u8, DImage::DImagePadReplicate, DImage::getImageType(), DImage::height(), DImage::numChannels(), DImage::padEdges_(), radiusX, radiusY, DImage::splitRGB(), and DImage::width().

void DMeanFilter::setRadii ( int  radiusX,
int  radiusY 
)

Set the kernel (window) radii for the mean filter.

The actual width of the window will be 2*radiusX+1

References radiusX, and radiusY.

Referenced by meanFilterImage().

void DMeanFilter::setType ( DMeanFiltType  filtType)

set the type of mean filter algorithm

By default, RGB and _u8 images will use Huang_circle and all others (including RGB_16 and _u16) will use the slow method
